name: Directory of Open Access Journals (DOAJ)
description: The Directory of Open Access Journals (DOAJ) provides a list of open access journals. Journals need to apply for a review process before they can be included into DOAJ.

name: dissemin
description: Dissemin detects papers behind pay-walls and invites their authors to upload them in one click to an open repository.
licence: CAPSH claims no ownership of the metadata served via this API. It has been collected from various free sources.  https://dissemin.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#license-usage
comment: entity type needs to be checked

name: Crossref Event Data
description:
The Event Data service captures data on discussions about about scholarly content in non-traditional places (online platforms for discussion, publication and social media)
and acts as a hub for the storage and distribution of this data. The service provides a record of instances where research has been bookmarked, linked, liked, shared, referenced, commented on etc, beyond publisher platforms. For example, when datasets are linked to articles, articles are mentioned on social media or referenced in Wikipedia.

name: OpenAIRE
description:
"OpenAIRE’s mission is closely linked to the mission of the European Commission: to provide unlimited, barrier free, open access to research outputs financed by public funding in Europe."

https://www.openaire.eu/mission-and-vision

name: NOA Scientific Image Search
description: "Harvesting, analysis and efficient reuse of scientific images using Wikimedia infrastructures"

name: BASE
description: "BASE is one of the world's most voluminous search engines especially for academic web resources. BASE provides more than 120 million documents from more than 6,000 sources. You can access the full texts of about 60% of the indexed documents for free (Open Access). BASE is operated by Bielefeld University Library."

name: DataCite
description: DataCite assigns persistent identifiers (digital object identifiers, DOIs) to research data. This provides the opportunity to locate and cite research data, among others.
comment: DataCite provides more than one interface! (thumbs up) see also https://support.datacite.org/docs/datacite-ez-api-guide and https://support.datacite.org/docs/mds-api-guide

name: Wikipedia
description: "The Free Encyclopedia" - https://www.wikipedia.org/

name: Publons
description: Publons is a company that provides a platform for scholars that want to share their merits in peer review. It also provides a widget that can be implemented, for example, in research information systems.

name: Open Patent Services (OPS)
description: A web service which to provide access via a standardised XML interface using RESTful architecture to a patent corpus by the European Patent Office. Up to 4 GB of data per week are free, transfer of more data requires payment. Registration is needed for API access.

name: GitHub
description:
"GitHub is a web-based hosting service for version control using Git. It is mostly used for computer code."
https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=GitHub&oldid=884200535

name: TIB AV-Portal
description:
"The TIB AV-Portal provides access to high grade scientific films from the fields of engineering, architecture, chemistry, computer science, mathematics and physics."
https://av.tib.eu/

name: COCI
description: "As of the most recent update on 4th July 2020, COCI contains metadata about 721,655,392 citations involving 58,876,621 bibliographic resources."
comment: A SPARQL endpoint is available, too: https://opencitations.net/index/sparql

name: Dimensions Metrics API
description: Dimensions is a data platform for discovery and analyzation of research, containing connections between grants, publications, clinical trials, patents and policy documents. The Metrics API can be queried using PubMed ID, DOI or Dimensions ID.
licence: Usage requires registration and attribution, see https://www.dimensions.ai/metricssignup/ for more information.

name: Unpaywall
description: Unpaywall finds open access copies of scholarly literature indexed in Crossref and returns open access full-text links as well as helpful metadata. It harvests Open Access content from over 50,000 publishers and repositories and is developed and maintained by the team of Impactstory.
comment: While the API allows to retrieve a limited amount of records, Unpaywall also offers database snapshots for large-scale analysis (https://unpaywall.org/products/snapshot).

name: CORE
description: "The world’s largest collection of open access research papers."

name: Zenodo
description: "Zenodo is a research data repository for the preservation and making available of research, educational and informational content." https://about.zenodo.org/terms/

name: dblp Computer Science Bibliography
description:
"The dblp computer science bibliography is the on-line reference for bibliographic information on major computer science publications. It has evolved from an early small experimental web server to a popular open-data service for the computer science community. Our mission at dblp is to support computer science researchers in their daily efforts by providing free access to high-quality bibliographic meta-data and links to the electronic editions of publications."

https://dblp.uni-trier.de/faq/What+is+dblp.html

name: BibSonomy
description: Bibsonomy is a social bookmarking and publication sharing platform.

name: Europe PMC
description:
"Europe PMC is a repository, providing access to worldwide life sciences articles, books, patents and clinical guidelines. Europe PMC provides links to relevant records in databases such as Uniprot, European Nucleotide Archive (ENA), Protein Data Bank Europe (PDBE) and BioStudies."

https://europepmc.org/About

name: PubMed
description:
"PubMed comprises over 29 million citations for biomedical literature from MEDLINE, life science journals, and online books. PubMed citations and abstracts include the fields of biomedicine and health, covering portions of the life sciences, behavioral sciences, chemical sciences, and bioengineering. [...] PubMed is a free resource that is developed and maintained by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), at the U.S. National Library of Medicine (NLM), located at the National Institutes of Health (NIH)."

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK3827/#pubmedhelp.PubMed_Quick_Start

name: Microsoft Academic Knowledge Graph
description:
"We present a large RDF data set with over eight billion triples with information about scientific publications and related entities, such as authors, institutions, journals, and fields of study. The data set is based on the Microsoft Academic Graph and licensed under the Open Data Attributions license."

https://ma-graph.org/

name: Sherpa Romeo
description: The SHERPA/RoMEO API delivers machine-to-machine access to a searchable database of publisher's policies regarding the self- archiving of journal articles on the web and in Open Access repositories.

name: WikiCite
description:
"WikiCite is a Wikimedia initiative to develop a database of open citations and linked bibliographic data to serve free knowledge."
https://wikicite.org/

name: Protocols.io
description: "protocols.io is the #1 open access repository for science methods" https://www.protocols.io/

name: Stack Exchange
description: "Launched in 2010, the Stack Exchange network comprises 173 Q&A communities including Stack Overflow, the largest, most trusted online community for developers to learn, share their knowledge, and build their careers." https://stackexchange.com/about

name: Altmetric Details Page API
description: "The open Altmetric Details Page API allows rate-limited querying of Altmetric metrics for research outputs."
comment:
Rate-limited queries to 1 call per second. 
https://api.altmetric.com/

name: Wikidata
description: Structured information of Wikipedia and its sister projects. Contains publication data, citations, data about authors, organizations, events and any other type of entity.
comment: Other APIs are available, for example a Linked Data Fragment service: https://query.wikidata.org/bigdata/ldf.

name: Paperbuzz
description: Paperbuzz collects and aggregates information about events around DOIs. It's based on Paperbuzz.

name: Plum Analytics
description:
"Plum Analytics uses research metrics to help answer the questions and tell the stories about research."

https://plumanalytics.com/

name: figshare
description: "figshare is a repository where users can make all of their research outputs available in a citable, shareable and discoverable manner" https://figshare.com/about

name: Web of Science
description: "Web of Science is a platform consisting of several literature search databases designed to support scientific and scholarly research." https://clarivate.libguides.com/webofscienceplatform/introduction

name: Semantic Scholar
description: "Semantic Scholar is a free, nonprofit, academic search engine from [Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence]." https://www.semanticscholar.org/

name: SciELO (Scientific Electronic Library Online) Analytics
description: "SciELO Network provides Open Access (OA) to journals’ contents. Journals are organized in national and thematic collections. Each collection is managed by a nationally recognized research organization. Selection of journals to be indexed in and discontinued of a collection is of entire responsibility of each collection management organization, usually with the support of a scientific advisory committee." https://www.scielo.org/en/about-scielo/open-access-statement

name: The Lens Scholarly API
description: The Lens Scholarly API provides information about works including Open Access status, license information, and scientific and patent citations.

name: SciELO Citation Index
description: "SciELO Citation Index is created in partnership with SciELO, the Scientific Electronic Library Online, and consists of Open Access journal content from Latin America, the Caribbean, Spain, Portugal, and South Africa." https://clarivate.libguides.com/webofscienceplatform/scielo

name: Scopus
description:
Scopus is an abstract and citation database. 
(https://www.elsevier.com/solutions/scopus?dgcid=RN_AGCM_Sourced_300005030)

name: Crossref
description: "Crossref interlinks millions of items from a variety of content types, including journals, books, conference proceedings, working papers, technical reports, and data sets." https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crossref

name: Open Access Button
description: Open Access Button delivers information about the open accessibility of publications.

name: OpenAlex
description: "OpenAlex is a free and open catalog of the world's scholarly papers, researchers, journals, and institutions — along with all the ways they're connected to one another." https://openalex.org/about

name: FREYA PID Graph
description: The FREYA PID Graph connects different objects of the research landscape like organization, person, work, funder and repository, each identified by a PID.

name: ORCID (Public API)
description: "ORCID strives to enable transparent and trustworthy connections between researchers, their contributions, and their affiliations by providing a unique, persistent identifier for individuals to use as they engage in research, scholarship, and innovation activities." https://info.orcid.org/what-is-orcid/
comment: HTTPS API with content negotiation, available formats include JSON, JSON-LD, XML

name: Research Organization Registry
description: "ROR (Research Organization Registry) is a community-led registry of open, sustainable, usable, and unique identifiers for every research organization in the world." https://ror.org/about/
licence: Creative Commons CC0 1.0 Universal Public Domain Dedication

name: Cordis
description: "The Community Research and Development Information Service (CORDIS) is the European Commission's primary source of results from the projects funded by the EU's framework programmes for research and innovation (FP1 to Horizon 2020)." https://cordis.europa.eu/about/en
comment: Build the GET URL by adding parameters as described in the documentation and use a "format" Parameter to get the search results as XML, JSON or CSV, e.g. "format=xml"

name: Springer Nature SciGraph
description: "Linked Open Data offering which aggregates data sources from Springer Nature and key partners from the scholarly domain." https://www.springernature.com/gp/researchers/scigraph
licence: depends (CC BY 4.0 license, CC BY-NC 4.0 license, CC0 1.0 waiver); for details and exceptions see https://scigraph.springernature.com/explorer/license/
comment: Data formats include JSON-LD, N-Triples, Turtle and RDF/XML. You can find examples of how to query the API in the Python library https://github.com/lambdamusic/PyScigraph

name: Fatcat
description: "Fatcat is a scalable, versioned, API-oriented catalog of bibliographic entities and file metadata." https://api.fatcat.wiki/redoc

name: Aminer
description: "AMiner  (aminer.org) aims to provide comprehensive search and mining services for researcher social networks." https://www.aminer.cn/introduction

name: Open Citations Meta
description: The OpenCitations Meta database stores and delivers bibliographic metadata for all publications involved in the OpenCitations Indexes
licence: The data held in any of the OpenCitations datasets are made freely available under a Creative Commons public domain dedication (CC0) (https://opencitations.net/about)
comment: A JSON Rest API is also available
